FuzzyGroup¶

class FuzzyGroup(name: str, xmin: float, xmax: float, fns: List[hotfis.membership.fuzzyfunc.FuzzyFunc])¶

Bases: object

A collection of membership functions corresponding to fuzzy sets.

Parameters

  • name – The name of the group.

  • xmin – Smallest group domain value used in Mamdani evaluation and visualization.

  • xmax – Largest group domain value used in Mamdani evaluation and visualization.

  • fns – A list of MembFuncs stored in the group.

fns¶

Dictionary of MembFuncs stored in the group. Their names are keys and the objects themselves are values.

Type

Dict[MembFunc]

name¶

The name of the group.

Type

str

domain¶

Domain for Mamdani evaluation and visualization.

Type

Tuple[float, float]

Methods

__getitem__(fn_name)

Supports subscripting with membership function name.

__iter__()

Can iterate through each membership function.

__setitem__(fn_name, fn)

Supports function assignment with subscripting.

items()

Returns each function name and object.

keys()

Returns the names of each contained membership function.

plot([start, stop, num_points, ...])

Plots every function in the group in a new figure.

values()

Returns each membership function.
__getitem__(fn_name) → hotfis.membership.fuzzyfunc.FuzzyFunc¶

Supports subscripting with membership function name.

Parameters

fn_name – Name of the function to retrieve.

__iter__()¶

Can iterate through each membership function.

__setitem__(fn_name: str, fn: hotfis.membership.fuzzyfunc.FuzzyFunc)¶

Supports function assignment with subscripting.

Will overwrite a function if it already exists.

Parameters

  • fn_name – The function name.

  • fn – Function to save in group.

items()¶

Returns each function name and object.

keys()¶

Returns the names of each contained membership function.

plot(start: Optional[float] = None, stop: Optional[float] = None, num_points: int = 500, stagger_labels: bool = False, line_color: str = 'black', fill_alpha=0.1, **plt_kwargs) → Tuple[matplotlib.axis.Axis, matplotlib.axis.Axis]¶

Plots every function in the group in a new figure.

Parameters

  • start – Specified start of plot domain. Defaults to group domain start if None is passed.

  • stop – Specified end of plot domain. Defaults to group domain end if None is passed.

  • num_points – Number of points to plot for each function.

  • stagger_labels – Whether to stagger function label names on top.

  • line_color – matplotlib.pyplot color of the line representing the function.

  • fill_alpha – Alpha of function color. Set to 0.0 for no fill.

  • **plt_kwargs – matplotlib.pyplot plotting options.

Returns

The main axis being plotted and a second twin axis on top where function names are written as xtick labels.

values()¶

Returns each membership function.
